column4: Hi, Just wanted to know if there is a "post-it" or "sticky notes"  type program for ubuntu/linux  ?
hmm.. wow lots of choice, so which one is the recommended ?
k ty , i have gnome , so i guess i'll try tomboy or desklets
k
Umm.. anotehr bigger prob is that: My x-sane runs only as a root with my hp-PSC 1510 ? any ideas/suggestions?
- add yourself to the scanner group
umm.. i think i tried that but it didnt help (i hope i tried it the corrrect way :) )
can you go in terminal and type in "groups" just to be sure?
ya the user is in the group "scanner"
hm. i really cant find the reason - my scanner wasnt working in the first place - - hplip installed and root can see it?
if root can see it, and you're a user under scanner group - try restarting your computer and test it again
and my "stupid" hp printer-scanner always wants to print a test page whenever it is started
ya i tried restarting when i did all that
hm. well - i really have no clue then :/ it works for my psc 2350... good luck on trying to get it to work
the thing is that i have to start it from terminal by typing "sudo xsane". but if I only type "xsane" it says "Segmentation fault (core dumped)"
anyway, it's ok . i'll keep on trying to find a solution :)
try doing "sudo scanimage -L" and see what comes out
gives the error "sudo: scanimage: command not found"
huh. strange - i thought that came with xsane. ah well
is that necessary to install for xsane to work. i mean like a dependency ?
not really sure - not in ubuntu atm
